channel.title: Java Problem? Computer issues? WTF?!
channel.description:
ok when i start to host my server, it runes all fine and dandy.
then i try setting up my client,and either it dosent load,or it lags like no-tomorrow.
OR
I load up my cleint, i load up my server
Major lag and
[KERNEL] Machine is too slow to run the server!!
appearing 30 times in my server.
I've deleted mass amounts of memory,and its still not cooperating with me.
So maybe my classpaths arent set up right?
Any help given to this topic is greatly appreciated.
Thanks for takeing your time to read this :D This is my logs, of what the server dose, just ignore the "cant find" errors. [code]Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. Starting CheezScape Server on 0.0.0.0:43594 config\objects.cfg: file not found. ClientHandler: Accepted from 0 Client type: high memory version UserId: 95229711 zezima is signing onto server. zezima: character file not found. zezima: moreinfo file not found. LOADED: 3 Game saved for player zezima ClientHandler: Client zezima disconnected. ClientHandler: Accepted from 0 Client type: high memory version UserId: 77581437 fayt is signing onto server. LOADED: 3 java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\apache2triad\htdocs\logs87\chatlogs.txt (The s ystem cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileOutputStream.openAppend(Native Method) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileWriter.<init>(Unknown Source) at client.parseIncomingPackets(client.java:16632) at client.packetProcess(client.java:14514) at client.process(client.java:14484) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:137) at server.main(server.java:47) [KERNEL]: machine is too slow to run this server! [KERNEL]: machine is too slow to run this server! [client-1-fayt]: playerCommand: yell im first yay java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\apache2triad\htdocs\logs87\commandlogs.txt (Th e system cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileOutputStream.openAppend(Native Method) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileWriter.<init>(Unknown Source) at client.parseIncomingPackets(client.java:17870) at client.packetProcess(client.java:14514) at client.process(client.java:14484) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:137) at server.main(server.java:47) [KERNEL]: machine is too slow to run this server! [KERNEL]: machine is too slow to run this server! [KERNEL]: machine is too slow to run this server! [KERNEL]: machine is too slow to run this server![/code]

item.title: Java Problem? Computer issues? WTF?!
item.dc:creator: @Marz Marz
item.description:
@Marz wrote:

I have this exact same error… help

Read full topic

item.title: Java Problem? Computer issues? WTF?!
item.dc:creator: @KsMuffin KsMuffin
item.description:
@KsMuffin wrote:

On another topic

search for C:\apache2triad\htdocs\logs87\commandlogs.txt and comment out the logging process… and if you dont know how dont bother with the server -.-

Its actualy very strange, i’ve allready added those in that location, still gives the error but i dont bother with it because it dosent effect the way the server runs.

And my problem was within server.java , i miss added a Nullpointerexception code.

Thanks for all the help.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Problem? Computer issues? WTF?!
item.dc:creator: @pur3_d3ath pur3 d3ath
item.description:
@pur3_d3ath wrote:

ive tried her server and its good, so its not like dont bother.

Read full topic

item.title: Java Problem? Computer issues? WTF?!
item.dc:creator: @KsMuffin KsMuffin
item.description:
@KsMuffin wrote:

Hmm you may have a point there, i added somthing recently that was SUPPOSED to stop NullPointerExceptions or somthing like that, but it seriously gave me some errors.

Thanks for your response!

Read full topic

item.title: Java Problem? Computer issues? WTF?!
item.dc:creator: @pur3_d3ath pur3 d3ath
item.description:
@pur3_d3ath wrote:

I had the same problem earlier today, you must have added something to one of your codes/scripts, this happened to me and i had to restart my computer 3 times, and then fix the code, try deleting something you just recently added to it…

Read full topic
